node.title: SA records highest daily COVID-19 total since April last year, as international quarantine time cut
node.alt: A man wearing a suit and tie and glasses
node.description: South Australia records 26 new cases of COVID-19, the highest daily total since April 2020. The Premier says quarantine periods for international arrivals will reduce from 14 to seven days.
node.content:
["South Australia\u00a0has recorded 26 new cases of COVID-19, the highest daily total since April 2020.", "Two cases identified yesterday were health workers who had attended a number of aged care facilities.", "So far, six aged care facilities have been identified as sites of concern.", "Premier Steven Marshall said a high level of testing was underway at those sites, but there was no evidence so far of further transmission.", "Mr Marshall said about 1,400 people were currently in quarantine.", "\"We're going to continue to have more cases in South Australia; importantly, though, we are seeing the number of people that are in directed quarantine continue to fall,\" he said.", "Mr Marshall defended the state's contact tracing, after a delay in naming\u00a0exposure sites\u00a0\u2014\u00a0including one\u00a0listed last night, 10 days after a case had attended.", "\"A lot of the information does come in late because you're speaking to people and then they recall where else they may have been or could have been an actual transmission that wasn't there previously,\" he said.", "\"So look I'm absolutely 100 per cent\u00a0convinced we have provided the adequate resources, we've been asked for more resources, we've provided more resources, I think our contact tracing is the best in the world.", "\"But what we do need to understand is it's a changed environment from where we were even just two months ago.", "\"So it is important to list exposure sites so people have got some information, but we are at a different level of stress with regards to this disease from where we were two to three weeks ago and certainly where we were two to three months ago.\"", "
International arrival quarantine\u00a0cut to seven days
", "Mr Marshall said quarantine periods for international arrivals would reduce from 14 to seven days, effective immediately.", "The state had previously moved to seven-day quarantine when it opened its borders on November 23, but backtracked days later because of concerns over the Omicron variant of COVID-19.", "Mr Marshall said the change would provide \"huge relief\" for people travelling into the state\u00a0for Christmas.", "Mr Marshall said the state was \"still working out\" what the quarantine period for international arrivals would be once the state reached\u00a090 per cent vaccination for the population 12 and over, but said it was \"unlikely that it would go to zero given the level of uncertainty with Omicron\".", "Mr Marshall said the \"significant increase\" in case numbers in NSW\u00a0meant\u00a0testing requirements for people travelling from that state\u00a0would remain \"for some time\".", "\"I\u00a0can't see us in South Australia removing that testing requirement pre-departure and after departure moving anytime soon,\" he said.", "SA Health has not added any exposure sites for today, but did revise\u00a0some of the previously listed sites.", "Check the table below to find all the sites and exposure windows.", "You can find information on\u00a0testing site hours and the nearest site to you on the SA Health\u00a0website.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
